noun.description: A preliminary version of a piece of writing.
examples: the first draft of the party's manifesto
25 million men were subject to the draft

noun.description: A current of cool air in a room or other confined space.
examples: heavy curtains at the windows cut out drafts

noun.description: The action or act of pulling something along, especially a vehicle or farm implement.
A written order to pay a specified sum; a check.
A single act of drinking or inhaling.
examples: she downed the remaining beer in one draft

noun.description: The depth of water needed to float a ship.
examples: the shallow draft enabled her to get close to shore

noun.description: The drawing in of a fishing net.

verb.description: Prepare a preliminary version of (a document)
examples: I drafted a letter of resignation

verb.description: Select (a person or group of people) and bring them somewhere for a certain purpose.
examples: he was drafted to help with the task force on best safety practices

verb.description: Benefit from reduced wind resistance by driving very closely behind another vehicle.

adjective.description: Denoting beer or other drink that is kept in and served from a barrel or tank rather than from a bottle or can.
Denoting an animal used for pulling heavy loads.

origin: Mid 16th century: phonetic spelling of draught.
